bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Commision
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District } ss
Before James G Swan a Commisions for the District Court of the United States in and for said district
United States vs Leonard Martin} charged with selling wiskey to Indians

Upon a complaint under oath and in writing made before me, James G Swan US Commision by JGClinger Deputy US Warrant on Friday tho 1st day of May AD 1885 charges that one Leonard Martin had been selling whisky to distains under the cause of a United States Indian Agent and witness tho Jurisdiction of said district a warrant was issued and Leonard Martin was arrested and brought beefore the Commision at 2 O'Clock in the Afternoon of said 1st day of May together with the following named Charles Finn. Thomas Delang. Indian Billy and his wife Annie.

The person was accompanied by his counsel Morris B Sack, eg Tho complaint harry been read by the correspon to the person to make plea of not guilty and waives examination Wherefore Leonard Martin the person was ordered to give bonds with good and sufficient sendis to the sum of one hundred dollars to been appeared before the District Court for the 3rd Judicial District holding terms at Port Townsend at its next term commands on the fourth Monday by Agent AD 1885 amd failing in such bonds was fully committed to the Custody of the US Deputy Marshal J Gellinger
Witnesses Indian Billy and his wife Annie was put under bonds in the sum of fifty dollars for there appearance at court which bond they expected with Frank A Barlfait samely.
United States of America vs District Mark Territory } ss

I James G Swan a Commission of the District Court of the US Ju this 3rd Dist do hach certify that this foregon is a time trascript of this proceedings before me in the cames theri named and that corpus or the proces and the examination and in vail came all havewith victory unto the District Court faith 3rd District at Port Townsend in Pensaid of law
Witness my hand this 4th day of May AD 1885 James G Swan WT Commisioner
No806 USCommission Court James G Swan
United States vs Leonard Martin} Selling Whiskey to Indians
Paper in case Complaint warrant of arrest suppeana of Witness commitment recongises of witness Commision fear $8.35 Warrant fee 4.50
